poem:
Title: "In the Palm of Contention"

Missiles bloom,
In the Gaza hour,
Beneath the Tel Aviv sun.
Netanyahu gathers his cabinet 
like ripe olives. 

Metaphors of war,
Echoes of truce,
In the Jerusalem twilight.
An orange, cut and shared,
In hopes of a softer ceasefire.

Words to seed peace,
Hours into minutes, 
Time, a hostage patiently waiting release.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Israel-Gaza war: Hamas’ armed wing says it has launched ‘big missile’ attack on Tel Aviv – as it happened 3.51pm BST Closing summary Israel’s prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, is to convene his war cabinet on Sunday to discuss the latest efforts towards a Gaza truce and hostage release deal, a senior official told AFP. An official told AFP that “the war cabinet is expected to meet in Jerusalem tonight at 2100 (1800 GMT) to discuss". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
